item.title: 气候多变导致气象机构在厄尔尼诺信息传递上出现分歧
item.description:
准确的解读对于政府、能源市场和农民来说至关重要，尤其是在全球变暖加剧极端天气的情况下。【原文：

An accurate read is essential for governments, energy markets and farmers, especially as global warming exacerbates extreme weather.

】

item.title: 大型树木供应商将破产归咎于加州干旱
item.description: 一家在家居装饰店销售树木和植物的主要供应商已申请破产，将其财务困境归咎于南加州的干旱状况以及最近的潮湿天气。【原文：A major supplier of trees and plants sold at home improvement stores has filed bankruptcy, blaming its financial trouble on drought conditions in Southern California followed by more recent wet weather.】

item.title: 德国大力发展绿色电力，预计到 2026 年底将降低电价
item.description: 据市场分析师称，德国推动建设更多可再生能源发电设施的举措将在明年年底前开始降低电力批发价格。【原文：A push to build more renewable generation in Germany will begin to bring down wholesale power prices by the end of next year, according to market analysts.】

item.title: 特朗普对电动卡车规则的威胁破坏了大集团的赌注
item.description:
严格的车辆电气化法规摇摇欲坠，阻碍了清洁经济中最肮脏行业之一的努力。【原文：

Stringent electrification regulations for the vehicles are teetering, hampering efforts to clean up one of the economy’s dirtiest sectors.

】

item.title: 印度酝酿 10 亿美元补贴计划以促进太阳能制造
item.description: 据知情人士透露，印度正在敲定一项 10 亿美元的资本补贴计划，以支持其太阳能制造业，这也是印度为减少对中国的依赖并从全球能源转型中获利而做出的更广泛努力的一部分。【原文：India is finalizing a $1 billion capital subsidy plan to bolster its solar manufacturing industry, according to people with knowledge of the matter, as part of a wider effort to reduce dependence on China and profit from the global energy transition.】

item.title: 欧洲电动汽车销量激增 37%，汽车制造商推动制定更宽松的二氧化碳法规
item.description: 上个月，欧洲电动汽车销量增长了 37%，原因是汽车制造商为遵守今年更严格的排放法规而大力推广其电池动力汽车。【原文：Europe’s electric-vehicle sales rose 37% last month as automakers promoted their battery-powered cars in order to comply with tighter emissions regulation this year.】

item.title: 伍德赛德公司表示，碳信用额是遏制排放的必要条件
item.description: 伍德赛德能源集团有限公司（Woodside Energy Group Ltd.）认为碳信用额仍可发挥作用，因为解决难以消减的排放预计需要成本。【原文：Woodside Energy Group Ltd. sees a continued role for carbon credits because of the projected costs of tackling difficult-to-abate emissions.】

item.title: 美国农业部因清除气候变化信息面临诉讼
item.description: 美国农业部在其网站上删除有关气候变化的信息，此举正面临法律挑战。【原文：The US Department of Agriculture is facing a legal challenge over its move to wipe out information on climate change from its websites.】

item.title: 欧盟在受到强烈批评后从环境、社会和治理议程中大举撤退
item.description: 有大量抱怨称，ESG 法规正成为阻碍欧盟与美国和亚洲竞争的绊脚石，因此欧盟即将收回大量计划中的 ESG 法规。【原文：The European Union is about to walk back significant chunks of planned ESG regulations, amid a barrage of complaints that such rules are becoming a dead weight hampering EU efforts to compete with the US and Asia.】

item.title: 法国希望欧盟给予汽车制造商排放灵活性
item.description: 法国希望欧盟给予该地区的汽车制造商更多的灵活性，以遵守今年的排放目标，因为他们担心如果达不到目标可能会面临罚款。【原文：France wants the European Union to give the region’s carmakers more flexibility to comply with emissions targets this year amid concerns that they could face fines for missing goals.】

item.title: 无人驾驶作物喷粉机提供更安全的新型耕作方式
item.description:
初创公司 Pyka 的电动飞机正在拉丁美洲的香蕉种植园中使用，以减少化学品的传播和排放。【原文：

Startup Pyka’s electric aircraft are being used on banana plantations across Latin America in a bid to reduce the spread of chemicals and cut emissions.

】

item.title: 陷入僵局的联合国自然谈判将在罗马重启，进行为期三天的冲刺
item.description:
在去年的缔约方大会第十六届会议陷入僵局之后，谈判代表将第二次尝试就阻止全球生物多样性丧失的资金问题达成一致。【原文：

After last year’s COP16 reached an impasse, negotiators will make a second attempt to agree on funding to halt the global loss of biodiversity. 

】

item.title: 马来西亚棕榈树洪灾问题将再持续一个月
item.description: 据一位业内高级官员称，马来西亚油棕种植园今年被雨水淹没，至少在一个月内产量不可能恢复。【原文：Malaysian oil palm plantations that have been inundated with rain this year aren’t likely to see production recover for at least another month, according to a senior industry official.】

item.title: 特朗普为全球引用最多的气候报告带来不确定性
item.description:
本周，参加联合国支持的一次重要气候会议的代表们将不得不考虑，如果没有美国政府的参与，他们未来的工作会是什么样子。【原文：

Delegates to a key UN-backed climate meeting this week will be forced to consider what their future work might look like without US government participation.

】

item.title: 英国气象局发布降雨和洪水 "危及生命 "警告
item.description: 气象局发布了黄色天气预警，暴雨和深层洪水可能会造成 "生命危险"。【原文：The Met Office has issued an amber weather warning for heavy rain and deep floodwater that could cause "danger to life".】

item.title: 欧盟委员会建议大幅削减尽职调查指令
item.description: 欧盟委员会建议大幅削弱其最具影响力的环境、社会和治理法规之一。【原文：The European Commission is proposing a significant watering down of what had been one of its most consequential pieces of ESG regulation.】

item.title: 美国有线电视新闻网（CNN）称，特朗普要求联邦科学家结束气候报告工作
item.description: 一位参与编写全球气候报告的科学家告诉美国有线电视新闻网（CNN），特朗普政府让美国政府科学家停止他们的工作。【原文：The Trump administration told US government scientists working on a global climate report to stop their work, one of the scientists involved told CNN.】

item.title: 大雪让美国东海岸滑雪胜地超越西部竞争对手
item.description:
强劲的暴风雪正在新英格兰部分地区倾泻数十英尺厚的积雪。滑雪者们正尽情享受着这难得的雪景。【原文：

Powerful storms are dumping dozens of feet of snow across parts of New England. Skiers are reveling in it while it lasts. 

】

item.title: 华尔街出走后，气候组织考虑取消 1.5C 目标
item.description:
在一波高调退出之后，零净值银行联盟（Net-Zero Banking Alliance）正在考虑对其成员条款进行全面修订。【原文：

The Net-Zero Banking Alliance is considering an overhaul of its membership terms after a wave of high-profile exits.

】

item.title: 英国拒绝确认未来基金，GB 能源面临新疑虑
item.description: 英国财政部正在考虑在其将于 6 月公布的多年支出计划中纳入哪些内容，因此，为英国新兴国有企业 GB 能源公司提供 83 亿英镑（105 亿美元）资金的一揽子承诺受到质疑。【原文：A promised £8.3 billion ($10.5 billion) funding package for the UK’s nascent state-owned company GB Energy is under question as the Treasury considers what to include in its multi year spending plan due in June.】

item.title: 无用的高压电线可能引发加州大火
item.description:
一条闲置了几十年的生产线被指控引发了洛杉矶地区致命的伊顿大火。【原文：

A line idle for decades has been accused of starting the LA area’s deadly Eaton Fire.

】

item.title: 南非港口城市德班配给水以抑制需求
item.description: 由于供不应求，南非东部港口城市德班将加强供水配给，给供水系统造成压力。【原文：South Africa’s eastern port city of Durban will intensify water rationing as demand outstrips supply, placing strain on the system.】

item.title: 英国放宽海上风电规定以推动可再生能源发展
item.description: 英国政府公布了加快海上风电等可再生能源项目推广的改革措施，以实现到 2030 年建成清洁电力系统的目标。【原文：The UK government unveiled reforms to speed up the rollout of renewable energy projects such as offshore wind as it targets a clean power system by 2030.】

item.title: StanChart 称 2025 年清洁能源目标难以实现
item.description: 渣打银行（Standard Chartered Plc）表示，该公司可能无法实现 2025 年只使用可再生能源满足其电力需求的目标，理由是在其开展业务的一些市场中缺乏选择。【原文：Standard Chartered Plc said it may not meet its 2025 target of using only renewable energy for its power needs, citing a lack of options in some of the markets in which it operates.】

item.title: 韩国在弹劾亲核领导人后取消反应堆计划
item.description: 原子能倡导者尹锡烈总统被弹劾后，反对党对韩国的长期能源政策有了更大的影响力，韩国因此缩减了核电计划。【原文：South Korea has scaled down its plans for nuclear power after the impeachment of President Yoon Suk Yeol, an atomic energy advocate, gave the opposition party greater influence over the country’s long-term energy policy.】

item.title: 新西兰将允许通过碳捕集与封存减少排放
item.description: 新西兰将通过允许企业抵消其他温室气体排放来激励企业在地下捕集和储存二氧化碳，从而帮助该国在 2050 年前实现净零排放。【原文：New Zealand will incentivize companies to capture and store carbon dioxide underground by allowing them to offset other greenhouse gas emissions, helping the nation’s push toward becoming a net-zero economy by 2050.】

item.title: Equis 为韩国风电场项目寻求超过 10 亿美元的贷款
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，清洁能源开发商 Equis Development Pte.【原文：Clean energy developer Equis Development Pte. is in talks with banks for a potential loan to fund an offshore South Korean wind farm project, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 拜登的能源部长格兰霍姆加入美国大型公用事业公司董事会
item.description: 詹妮弗-格兰霍姆（Jennifer Granholm）曾担任前总统乔-拜登（Joe Biden）的能源部长，现已被选入美国最大的电力控股公司之一爱迪生国际公司（Edison International）的董事会。【原文：Jennifer Granholm, who served as former President Joe Biden’s energy secretary, has been tapped to the board of Edison International, one of the US’s largest electric utility holding companies.】

item.title: 敦促英国放宽规划规则，让电网为 2030 年做好准备
item.description: 一位政府顾问表示，英国需要放宽规划规则，以确保其瘫痪的电网能够应对更高的需求和可再生能源电力的大规模建设。【原文：The UK needs to relax planning rules to ensure its choked electricity grid can cope with higher demand and a massive build-out of renewable power, a government adviser said.】

item.title: 科学家称欧盟碳市场应包括碳捕集与封存等清除措施
item.description: 欧盟有影响力的科学顾问说，一旦有了确保永久性碳清除（如捕集与封存项目）可信度的系统，欧盟就应将其纳入二氧化碳市场。【原文：The European Union should include permanent carbon removals — such as capture and storage projects — in its CO2 market as soon as there’s a system to ensure they’re credible, the bloc’s influential scientific advisers said.】
